name: Vegan Pumpkin Roll
description: Vegan Pumpkin Roll is an eye catching dessert that is sure to be the star at your holiday table. Fluffy and moist pumpkin cake is covered in a cream cheese-like frosting, then rolled up, chilled and sliced.
recipeIngredient: 4 tablespoons vegan butter, softened to room temperature

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and line a 10 x 15 inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper, with about a 1 inch overhang for easy removal after baking.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and line a 10 x 15 inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper, with about a 1 inch overhang for easy removal after baking.

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the pumpkin puree, applesauce, sugar and vanilla until well combined.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl, whisk together the pumpkin puree, applesauce, sugar and vanilla until well combined.

itemListElement.text: To the bowl with the pumpkin mixture, add ingredients in this order: flour, baking powder, baking soda, pumpkin pie spice and salt, then stir with a spoon or spatula until just combined. Be careful not to over mix.
itemListElement.name: To the bowl with the pumpkin mixture, add ingredients in this order: flour, baking powder, baking soda, pumpkin pie spice and salt, then stir with a spoon or spatula until just combined. Be careful not to over mix.

itemListElement.text: Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 14-15 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
itemListElement.name: Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 14-15 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

itemListElement.text: Remove from the oven. On a large surface, lay out a large clean dish towel, one with no texture if possible. Sprinkle liberally with powdered sugar. With one swift motion, flip the cake from the pan to the towel. Be confident and you will be fine! Alternatively, you can simply roll it up in the parchment paper, but mine cracked a bit when I tried it that way.
itemListElement.name: Remove from the oven. On a large surface, lay out a large clean dish towel, one with no texture if possible. Sprinkle liberally with powdered sugar. With one swift motion, flip the cake from the pan to the towel. Be confident and you will be fine! Alternatively, you can simply roll it up in the parchment paper, but mine cracked a bit when I tried it that way.

itemListElement.text: Peel off the parchment paper that is still stuck to the cake. Roll the cake up from one short end to the other end, carefully and using the towel. (SEE PHOTOS ABOVE FOR REFERENCE)
itemListElement.name: Peel off the parchment paper that is still stuck to the cake. Roll the cake up from one short end to the other end, carefully and using the towel. (SEE PHOTOS ABOVE FOR REFERENCE)

itemListElement.text: Let the cake cool completely for about 3 hours on a wire rack. Or stick it in the refrigerator to cool a bit faster.
itemListElement.name: Let the cake cool completely for about 3 hours on a wire rack. Or stick it in the refrigerator to cool a bit faster.

itemListElement.text: In a medium bowl with an hand or stand mixer, beat the vegan butter, shortening, powdered sugar, lemon juice and vanilla until smooth. Add a tablespoon or two of non-dairy milk (I used soy) if the frosting is too thick. If too thin, add more powdered sugar.
itemListElement.name: In a medium bowl with an hand or stand mixer, beat the vegan butter, shortening, powdered sugar, lemon juice and vanilla until smooth. Add a tablespoon or two of non-dairy milk (I used soy) if the frosting is too thick. If too thin, add more powdered sugar.

itemListElement.text: Once the cake is cooled completely, slowly unroll it, very gently to prevent cracking, then spread the filling over the cake, leaving about 1/4 inch border unfrosted. If there are a few cracks, don't worry, the roll won't be ruined. You can fix a lot with frosting and a dusting of powdered sugar!
itemListElement.name: Once the cake is cooled completely, slowly unroll it, very gently to prevent cracking, then spread the filling over the cake, leaving about 1/4 inch border unfrosted. If there are a few cracks, don't worry, the roll won't be ruined. You can fix a lot with frosting and a dusting of powdered sugar!

itemListElement.text: Re-roll the cake up, without the towel this time, carefully peeling it away as your roll. Tightly wrap the roll in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for about an hour.
itemListElement.name: Re-roll the cake up, without the towel this time, carefully peeling it away as your roll. Tightly wrap the roll in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for about an hour.

itemListElement.text: When ready to serve, unwrap the pumpkin roll and transfer to a serving dish. Dust with powdered sugar, slice and serve.
itemListElement.name: When ready to serve, unwrap the pumpkin roll and transfer to a serving dish. Dust with powdered sugar, slice and serve.

itemListElement.text: Leftovers: You can make the roll ahead of time and store in the refrigerator for about 5 days wrapped in plastic wrap. Or freeze for a month or two. They make great gifts!
itemListElement.name: Leftovers: You can make the roll ahead of time and store in the refrigerator for about 5 days wrapped in plastic wrap. Or freeze for a month or two. They make great gifts!
